ABOUT THE ROLE
 
 
   Welcome to TelevisaUnivision Dallas! TelevisaUnivision Dallas is seeking a talented highly motivated, experienced, hands-on Director of Technology (DOT) to manage and support the market’s TV/Radio stations.
 
 
   The Director of Technology participates in and directs the installation, maintenance and repair of TV/Radio transmitters and production systems to maintain competitive signals in the market while complying with all FCC technical requirements. Responsibilities include maintaining telecommunications equipment, computers, networking systems and integrating platforms for online content.
 
 
   The Engineering Team culture is one of responsiveness to internal and external customers.
 
 
 
   ABOUT YOU:
 
 
 
   The ideal candidate will have the opportunity to work with and motivate the TelevisaUnivision Dallas Engineering team while helping to maintain top-notch signals in a Major Market. Ongoing opportunities to learn and work on systems such as RF transmission systems, Avid, Axia, Zetta, Evertz, and new cutting-edge technology like ATSC 3.0 on our Dallas station KSTR.
 
 
 
   YOUR DAY-DAY:
 
 
   Rapidly assess, troubleshoot and work to correct technical problems and/or employ viable and timely alternatives to facilitate operational objectives.
   Maintain quality station operation through ongoing preventive and corrective maintenance, and the establishment and tracking of maintenance schedules for the Engineering Team.
   Maintain high-power RF transmitters, transmission antennas, satellite antenna systems, signal distribution systems, encoders, and routing systems.
   Install, document, and maintain production systems, control consoles, video/audio routers, recording equipment, microphones, digital audio systems, control systems, remote equipment, etc.
   Provide maintenance and support of IT/Telephony networks and related IT/Telephony equipment infrastructure.
   Provide basic troubleshooting and maintenance of facility infrastructure systems such as generators, UPS systems, HVAC, and BMS control systems.
   Work closely with the News, Operations and Radio Programming Teams to maintain current systems and to develop and integrate future systems.
   Ensure station compliance with rules and regulations applicable to FCC, local, state, and federal laws.
 
 
   YOU HAVE:
 
 
   Associates degree or higher in electronics, or computer related field.
   SBE Certification of CBRE, CBTE, CSRE, CSTE, or CPBE desired.
   Ability to work in a high-pressure environment, and to maintain professional composure and provide critical thinking to problem resolution in high stress and time sensitive environments.
   Working knowledge of Television/Radio production, transmission, and broadcast IT equipment and systems.
   Ability to troubleshoot broadcast equipment to the component level.
   Ability to troubleshoot and repair high-power TV and FM transmission equipment.
   Good understanding of applicable FCC rules and regulations
   Computer literacy in applicable software packages and operating systems (Microsoft, iOS, Linux, TV/Radio automation, CAD, Avid, Adobe, etc.)
   Ability to read, interpret and create design documentation, including elevations, connection drawings and schematics.
   A valid Drivers License
   Ability to work any shift, as dictated by the needs of a 24/7 business.
   Spanish a plus.
 
 
   OUR BENEFITS:
 
 
   TelevisaUnivision believes that a happy, well-balanced employee is what makes our culture thrive. We offer a wide selection of perks and benefits including PTO; tuition reimbursement; wellness and employee support programs; 401K; and life and other insurance plans. This is all in addition to our comprehensive and competitive health benefits package featuring medical, dental and vision coverage options.

The Company is an equal opportunity employer, and will reasonably accommodate a qualified candidate, who may be unable to be vaccinated, consistent with federal, state, and local law.
